subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text: Variant of {{l|mul|黑}}. {{Han simp|黑}}, replacing two dots with one stroke. The modern Japanese usage is of reform (shinjitai) nature. Compare {{m|ja|毋}}, the shinjitai of {{m|mul|母}}.

subSections.title: Compounds
Etymology
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}} {{wikipedia|Black}} [[File:Solid_black.svg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|黒}} (''kuro''): the colour '''[[black]]'''.]]
{{ja-kanjitab|くろ|yomi=k}} {{IPAfont|⟨kuro1⟩}} → {{IPAchar|/kuro/}} From {{der|ja|ojp|-|sort=くろ}}, from {{inh|ja|jpx-pro|*kuro}}, first attested in the ''{{w|Kojiki}}'' (712 {{CE}}). Via root [[morpheme]] ''*kur'', cognates include: * {{m|ja|涅|tr=kuri||[[black]] [[mud]] from the [[bed]] of a body of water}}{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}} * {{m|ja|暗|tr=kura||[[darkness]]; [[deception]]}}, {{m|ja|[[蔵]], [[倉]], [[庫]]|tr=kura||[dark] [[storehouse]]}}, and {{m|ja|暗い|tr=kurai||[[dark]]}} * classical verb {{m|ja|暮る|tr=kuru}}, modern {{m|ja|暮れる|tr=kureru||to become dark; to near the end [of a day, of a year, of a life}}, and {{m|ja|[[暗れる]], [[眩れる]]|tr=kureru||to become [[depressed]], to become [[dreary]] of [[mood]]}} Compare {{cog|trk-pro|*kara|t=black}}, {{cog|mn|хар|tr=khar|t=black}}. Possibly also cognate with {{cog|ko|구름|t=cloud}}; compare also {{cog|ja|雲|tr=kumo|t=cloud}} and {{cog|ko|-}} {{m|ko||검|tr=*geom|t=black}}, root [[morpheme]] of {{m|ko|검다|t=to be black|pos=ve​rb}}, {{m|ko|검은|t=black|pos=a}}. May be connected to {{cog|ine-pro|*kr̥snós||black}} (whence {{cog|sa|कृष्ण|tr=kṛṣṇá}}), suggesting a Wanderwort in Asia, possibly from an Indo-Iranian language.
